Uh, how? Enemy team focuses Camille. Who is now stuck. If she flees, ADC escapes. If she doesn't, she dies. If Camille's team focuses protecting her, ADC rains hell on them. If Camille's team focuses ADC, they kill Camille. If Camille's team tries to focus the enemy team and leave Camille/ADC to their own, it still won't work. Shielding items + Summoner Spells, for one. Two, they can focus on either killing Camille or protecting their ADC with one half and then use the other half of their team to CC/stop the enemy team from trying to stop them. If Camille's team blows CC on ADC, ADC's team wipes them. If Camille's team blows CC on ADC's team, they also get CC'd back in kind and wiped by the ADC.

The one that makes the first move loses the advantage. And besides just moving in, the ADC's team can force the enemy team to make it.

I don't think you understand how brutally this counters a ton of champions tho. 

The area is a lot smaller, meaning there's less room for positioning, and it also deals a dick ton of damage immediately. This is incredibly strong against certain champs, especially when you consider that most ADCs and Mages are not equipped with an escape, aside from Flash. 

Another thing to keep in mind is how obstructive this ultimate is, regardless of if his target is able to escape. When used in the right spot, this can dramatically affect the positioning of carries and the divers' chance of reaching the backline. Most notably, of course, is how much this counters Olaf, who would otherwise run straight past the tanky frontliners. 

IMO, Camille is more of a better Xin Zhou than a better J4. Xin's whole purpose is to isolate his target and challenge them to a duel, whether their team is present or not. However, it takes 2 buttons to maybe accomplish this, while Camille has both of those abilities on her ultimate, PLUS an extra gap closer. She's better than him in every way but skillfloor.

People are arguing that Xin's ult is the defensive version, while Camille's ult is the offensive version. Xin can knock back everyone, but Camille always leaves one target. Xin gains resistances, Camille gains damage.
Jarvan Ulti can do 60% of someone hp...

Let me try and get this through to you

Jarvan ult does AOE damage, and keeps MORE THAN ONE PERSON together. Her ult keeps ONE person in a place for a 1v1. Jarvan's ult isn't useless, Camille doesn't set up for perfect AOE on an entire team, does she? Are you gonna say you'd rather have a Camille Rumble comp than Jarvan Rumble?

And yea, his ult has a counter, mobility. It has the ability to trap your entire team, so it needs counterplay. Maybe you should bait out the mobility spell before using it?

These ults are not comparable. They're for completely two different things. Different champs, different kits, different reasons for why to use the ult.

Xin's weakness was never about his utility or damage but the lack thereof, no escapes, no playmaking, the only game play decision xin has to seriously think about is whether or not he should rush his opponent.

He is a victim of his own design, a champion that really only thrives based on the meta or when his numbers are slightly overturned and when they are  he no longer becomes a decent or Fairly strong but rather becomes a very menacing pubstomper.

Really I would say it is a better {{champion:5}} ultimate. They both do the same thing, displace enemies to make a target vulnerable. Want to know the real... eh-hem, *kicker?* it does it far better in nearly every regard.
